intro: Ononis intermedia, commonly known as intermediate whitlow grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Ononis intermedia is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides.
